Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Three Pen Cases
Description: These three wooden pen cases have long cavities that were closed with thin wooden lids.On the right-hand edges of the cases, two round depressions were carved. One of them was used to contain black ink, needed to write normal text, while the second depression held the red ink for marking the beginning of a new chapter.
